intro: Trillium erectum f. parvum, commonly known as the dwarf white trillium, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Trilliaceae family and is characterized by its three narrow, lance-shaped leaves and a single white flower with three petals. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist woodlands and thrives in acidic soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in many regions. Its unique botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists alike.
